ratings.comment: Definitely cares about the topic and it shows in his lectures because he is always prepared and ready to answer questions and give information beyond class material. Very approachable and looks like Gaston from Beauty and the Beast. Understands the material and wants his students to understand it to. LOTS of readings, but exams aren't too bad. READ

Overall a good professor--clear, enthusiastic, and helpful, though somewhat repetitive at times.  Lectures gets repetitive by the end because you take notes continuously throughout each lecture.  Only brief outlines provided beforehand, no slides.  Not too hard, no need to read all readings. Key: review study sheet before each exam.

His lectures are a little boring but definitely essential.  I didn't do any of the readings but still managed an A.  As long as you study from the study guides and know everything on there, along with knowing the broad idea from each of the readings, you'll do just fine in the class.
Exams are writing intensive, but study guide is really helpful. GO TO CLASS! Class outlines are not helpful at all, so you really need to go to lecture. Overall, fairly easy class.

HE IS BEAUTIFUL. awesome lecturer, very passionate and experienced with the topic. tests are difficult and all writing, but you get a study guide telling you exactly what you need to know. awesome class, take it take it take it.

The class was interesting but he got so involved in certain topics that he'd get behind and then rush through something and expect you to understand it for the exams. If it wasn't for the review sessions held by the TA's I would've been lost. Class is very reading intensive and much needed to do remotely well on the exams!

He seems like a really nice guy, but one of the worst lecturers I've ever had.  Boring, repetitive, no notes, and the tests don't reflect the material.  I had high hopes for the class but was significantly let down.
He's sooooo hunky.  We love it when he talks about TEK.

loved him! attending lectures is a must, and readings (sometimes) are interesting. you can get an A with some effort. a good lecturer with valid points. i didnt hear too much repetition. TA's are also extremely helpful.
This guy is a good lecturer and the readings are not a waste of time.  The class was an easy A and if you are looking for ethnic studies I would pick it.
It's not necessary to attend every lecture or do any of the readings.  A's for all.  Really a nice man, but not passionate for the subject.

He is a very sweet man and clear about the points he wants to get across.  Lecture analysis, however, is superficial or absent.  The three simple points covered during the first day of class will be the only ones covered throughout the course: repetition, repetition, repetition.
He's a cool guy- really interesting and a good lecturer...I recommend Anthro 314 with him!
